content.p: Cookies help us to give you the best experience on our website. You can change your cookie settings if you wish. Otherwise we'll assume you're OK to continue.OKSee our policy We offer a range of support to ensure that our facilities and services are accessible to disabled students and those with a long-term health condition or Specific Learning Difficulty for example dyslexia, dyspraxia or ADHD. Please ask any member of staff about how to access these services. An enhanced service for disabled students including dedicated study spaces and extended loan and collection periods. Enhanced Library Support Accessible versions of resources for students with a visual or print impairment. Referral required. Alternative formats service We offer dedicated bookable Assistive Technology and Enhanced Support rooms for eligible students. Enhanced Library Support study spaces Explore tools and services that help improve materials accessibility. Student accessibility A range of assistive software is available on University PCs. Assistive software Book height adjustable desks and calm spaces Assistive hardware King's Meadow Campus Lenton Lane Nottingham, NG7 2NR Please see our Help and support page for telephone and email contact points
